an ascetic vow of standing on one foot only while meditating or observing a rite.
an ascetic who has taken a vow of standing on foot only while meditating or observing a rite.
a vow of an ascetic that he lies on one side of his body only, while sleeping.
a seat of honour.
a single bench of judges of a judicial system (a bench having a single judge to hear and decide a legal case).
a single manner, way or style or uniformity in different systems, manner etc.
(log.) the doctrine that under similar circumstances the nature behaves in a similar way; law of uniformity of nature.
the doctrine that geological changes were brought about not in the main by great convulsions but by such action as may be seen going on now; uniformitarianism.
the state or fact of being uniform; uniformity.
capable of reacting with one equivalent of an acid.
(of an acid) having one replaceable hydrogen atom; monobasic.
the state or condition of (different straight lines) passing through a single point of concurrence.
a very primitive limpet-like class of molluscs; monoplacophora.
(vīr.) the act of (several people) eating from the same dining plate or vessel.
unity of minds.
a meditating, working on one object single-mindedly; the fact or state of having a single aim or purpose.
the fact or an instance of treating every one or every thing equally; absence of biasedness, partiality or preference.
using only one language; monoglot.
a person who uses only one language; a monoglot.
an eating ೊ್, but one meal a day; a living so.
a man who lives on only one meal a day.
a single meal of the day.
the absolute authority or power over a state or region.
the condition or the fact of growing one crop a year; crop so grown.
the fact or state of a person enjoying solely a property, authority; an exclusive, sole authority.
belonging, entitling or qualifying a single person to enjoy (a property, office, authority, etc.).
an opinion held by all; general agreement; consensus; unanimity.
the concentrated mind; the mind having no deviations from the subject it is meditating on.
= (correctly) ಏಕಮತ.
ಏಕಮತ್ಯ ಕಾಕು ಮಾಡದು ēkmatya kāku māḍadu (prov.) consensus avoids all problems.
= ಏಕಮತಿ.
one only; being alone; having no second one.
having a single syllable.
(pros.) that which has only one syllable.
= ಏಕಮಾತ್ರ2.
